_format.name: _format
_format.description: Response format type. The HTTP `Accept` header is used as the format if this parameter is unspecified. If the `Accept` header is unspecifed too, then `JSON` is used. Keys of the elements that do not start with a letter or an underscore are prefixed with an underscore for `XML`. Fields of the list type are skipped for `CSV`.

_with.name: _with
_with.description: Comma-separated list of field names, which defines a filter for the response objects: only those objects will be included in the response which have at least one field from this list, and only such fields will be included (fields not on this list will be omitted). Nested fields must be referenced by joining their names via a period, for example: `_with=id,parameters.name`.

_filter.name: filter
_filter.description: This is a family of parameters rather than a fixed-name parameter: any number of response object fields can be specified as parameters, with the desired field values as parameter values. It defines a filter for the response objects: only objects having the specified field values will be included in the response. Nested fields must be referenced by joining their names via a period - see the example.

_keepDefault.name: _keepDefault
_keepDefault.description: If `false` or unspecified, then in the response objects the Server will omit fields which have values equal to their default values. Otherwise, such fields will not be omitted.

_language.name: _language
_language.description: Preferred language for texts in the response body. If unspecified, then `en_US` is used.

_local.name: _local
_local.description: If `false` or unspecified, the information in the response will be collected from other Servers in the System as well. If specified as empty or `true`, then only the Server processing the request will provide information.

_strict.name: _strict
_strict.description: If `false` or unspecified, the Server will produce available results, ignoring minor errors. If specified as empty or `true`, then the request will fail on any error.
